original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“Sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  sutam mā ita bho gotama
translated: After the exchange of courtesies, he sat down to one side and said to the Lord:

original: ‘na samaṇo gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī’ti.🔽Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, tatheva.
analyzed: na samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti iti  tayida bho gotama tathā iva
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard that the ascetic Gotama does not pay homage to brahmins who are old, aged, burdened with years, advanced in life, and come to the last stage, that he does not stand up for them or offer them a seat.

original: Na hi bhavaṁ gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
analyzed: na hi bhavam gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti
translated: This is indeed the case, for Master Gotama does not pay homage to brahmins who are old, aged, burdened with years, advanced in life, and come to the last stage, he does not stand up for them or offer them a seat.

original: Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, na sampannamevā”ti.
analyzed: bho gotama na sampannam eva ati
translated: This is not proper for Master Gotama.”

original: “Nāhaṁ taṁ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yamahaṁ abhivādeyyaṁ vā paccuṭṭheyyaṁ vā āsanena vā nimanteyyaṁ.
analyzed: na aham ta brāhmaṇa passāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya yam aham abhivādeyyam vā paccuṭṭheyyam vā āsanena vā nimanteyya
translated: “Brahmin, I do not see that person in this world — with its devas, Maras, and Brahmas, in this generation with its royalty and brahmins, its householders and contemplatives, its devas and humans — by whom I should bow down, or rise up, or offer a seat.

original: Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato abhivādeyya vā paccuṭṭheyya vā āsanena vā nimanteyya, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā”ti.
analyzed: yat hi brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ abhivādeyya vā paccuṭṭheyya vā āsanena vā nimanteyya muddhā api tassa vipateyya ati
translated: If my head were to fall off because of this, it would be as if it had been cut off with a razor.”

original: “Arasarūpo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: a rasa rūpaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Master Gotama is without beauty.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:🔽‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  a rasa rūpaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking rightly could say that the Tathagata is without beauty.

original: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūparasā saddarasā gandharasā rasarasā phoṭṭhabbarasā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: ye te brāhmaṇa rūpa rasā sadda rasāḥ gandha rasāḥ rasa rasā phoṭṭhabba rasā te tathāgatassa pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: Inasmuch as the Tathāgata has abandoned, uprooted, done away with, and annihilated craving for sensual pleasures, craving for existence, and craving for non-existence,

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: this is a way in which one speaking rightly could say that the Tathagata is without beauty.

original: ‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: a rasa rūpaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: but not in the way you’re thinking.”

original: “Nibbhogo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: nibbhogaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama free from sensual pleasures?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “There is a way in which one could rightly say that I am free from sensual pleasures,

original: ‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: nibbhogaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: but not in the way you’re thinking.”

original: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūpabhogā saddabhogā gandhabhogā rasabhogā phoṭṭhabbabhogā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: ye te brāhmaṇa rūpa bhogā sadda bhogā gandha bhogā rasa bhogā phoṭṭhabba bhogā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: “The pleasures of the senses, the pleasures of being reborn, and the pleasures of renunciation: the Realized One has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and obliterated them, so that they are unable to arise in the future.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way in which one could rightly say that I am free from sensual pleasures,

original: ‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: nibbhogaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: but not in the way you’re thinking.”

original: “Akiriyavādo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: a kiriya vādaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama a nihilist?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “There is a way in which one could rightly say that I am a nihilist,

original: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: a kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: but not in the way you’re thinking.”

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, akiriyaṁ vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa; anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ akiriyaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇa akiriyam vadāmi kāya duccaritassa vacī duccaritassa manaḥ duccaritassa aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam akiriyam vadāmi
translated: I say that bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct should not be done, and that the many kinds of bad unwholesome qualities should not be done.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the method by means of which one speaking rightly would say that I am one who teaches non-doing.

original: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: a kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: But this is not what you had in mind when you said that I am one who teaches non-doing.”

original: “Ucchedavādo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: uccheda vādaḥ
translated: “Master Gotama is one who teaches annihilation.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:🔽‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  uccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: “There is a method by means of which one speaking rightly would say that I am one who teaches annihilation.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, ucchedaṁ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa; anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ ucchedaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇaḥ ucchedam vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam ucchedam vadāmi
translated: I say that lust, hatred, and delusion should be annihilated, and that the many kinds of bad unwholesome qualities should be annihilated.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the method by means of which one speaking rightly would say that I am one who teaches annihilation.

original: ‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: uccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: But this is not what you had in mind when you said that I am one who teaches annihilation.”

original: “Jegucchī bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: jegucchī bhavam gotama uti
translated: “You’re disgusted, Master Gotama.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:🔽‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking correctly could say that I am disgusted.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena; jigucchāmi anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇa jigucchāmi kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena jigucchāmi aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā
translated: I am disgusted with bodily misconduct, with verbal misconduct, with mental misconduct, with the acquisition of unwholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is a way in which one speaking correctly could say that I am disgusted.

original: ‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: But you were not speaking correctly.”

original: “Venayiko bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: venayikaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “You’re a teacher of a doctrine of purification, Master Gotama.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:🔽‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking correctly could say that I am a teacher of a doctrine of purification.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa; anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇa vinayāya dhammam desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam vinayāya dhammam desemi
translated: I teach the Dhamma for the purification of beings, for the overcoming of sorrow and lamentation, for the disappearance of pain and grief, for the attainment of the true way, for the realisation of Nibbāna.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way in which a correct description of me would be:🔽‘The ascetic Gotama is one who teaches a doctrine of austerity,’

original: ‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: but not in the way you have stated it.”

original: “Tapassī bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: tapassī bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Master Gotama is an ascetic.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which a correct description of me would be:

original: ‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: tapassī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is one who teaches a doctrine of austerity.’

original: Tapanīyāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ.
analyzed: tapanīyā āha brāhmaṇa pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccarita
translated: I say that evil unwholesome states are to be scorched by the fire of zeal.

original: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṁ ‘tapassī’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho brāhmaṇa tapanīyā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham tapassi iti vadāmi
translated: One in whom evil unwholesome states that should be scorched by the fire of zeal have been scorched, I say is a scorcher.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho brāhmaṇa tapanīyā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: Evil unwholesome states are scorched by the fire of zeal in the Tathagata.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak.

original: ‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: tapassī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: But you have not taken me as a type.”

original: “Apagabbho bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ bhavam gotama iti
translated: “Master Gotama is free from the rod.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking rightly of me would speak:

original: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: ‘The recluse Gotama is free from the rod.’

original: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṁ ‘apagabbho’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho brāhmaṇaḥ āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham apagabbhā ti vadāmi
translated: I say that one is free from the rod who has abandoned the conceit ‘I am,’ cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it is no more subject to future arising.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho brāhmaṇaḥ āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned the conceit ‘I am,’ cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it is no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak:

original: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesi.
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is free from lust,’ but not in the way you think.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api brāhmaṇa kukkuṭiyāḥ aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā
translated: Suppose a hen had eight, ten, or twelve eggs,

original: Tānāssu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni.🔽Yo nu kho tesaṁ kukkuṭacchāpakānaṁ paṭhamataraṁ pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena
analyzed: kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni  yaḥ nu kho tesam kukkuṭa chāpakānam paṭhamataram pāda nakha sikhāya vā mukha tuṇḍakena
translated: and she sat on them properly, brooded over them properly, and incubated them properly.

original: vā aṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya, kinti svāssa vacanīyo: ‘jeṭṭho vā kaniṭṭho vā’”ti?
analyzed: vā aṇḍa kosam padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya kinti sva assa vacanīyaḥ jeṭṭhaḥ vā kaniṭṭhaḥ vā ati
translated: If the chicks hatched safely, would they all be the same size?’

original: “Jeṭṭho tissa, bho gotama, vacanīyo. So hi nesaṁ, bho gotama, jeṭṭho hotī”ti.
analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ tissa bho gotama vacanīyo saḥ hi na isa bho gotama jeṭṭhaḥ hoti iti
translated: ‘No, Master Gotama.

original: “Evamevaṁ kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, avijjāgatāya pajāya aṇḍabhūtāya pariyonaddhāya avijjaṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā ekova loke anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho.
analyzed: evam evam khalu aha brāhmaṇa avid jāgatāya pajāya aṇḍa bhūtāya pariyonaddhāya avid jaṇḍa kosam padāletvā ekaḥ iva loke anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: ‘In the same way, brahmin, I have awakened to the supreme perfect awakening in this world—alone, without a peer.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, jeṭṭho seṭṭho lokassa.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇa jeṭṭhaḥ seṭṭhaḥ lokassa
translated: I am the eldest and best in the world.

original: Āraddhaṁ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṁ ahosi asallīnaṁ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṁ cittaṁ ekaggaṁ.
analyzed: āraddham kho pana me brāhmaṇa vīriyam ahosi a sallīnaḥ upaṭṭhitā sati a sammuṭṭhā passaddhaḥ kāyaḥ a sāraddhaḥ samāhitam cittam ekagga
translated: My persistence was aroused & not lax, my mindfulness established & not confused, my body calm & not agitated, my mind centered & unified.

original: So kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;
analyzed: saḥ kho aha brāhmaṇa vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi
translated: Quite secluded from sensuality, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered & remained in the first jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought & evaluation.

original: vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;🔽pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharāmi sato ca sampajāno sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedemi
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharāmi sataḥ ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedemi
translated: With the stilling of directed thoughts & evaluations, I entered & remained in the second jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of concentration, unification of awareness free from directed thought & evaluation — internal assurance.

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi
translated: With the fading of rapture, I remained equanimous, mindful, & alert, and sensed pleasure with the body. I entered & remained in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous & mindful, he has a pleasant abiding.’

original: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharāmi
translated: And with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, I entered and remained in the fourth jhāna, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi🔽jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  saḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi seyyathida ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tissaḥ api  jātiyo catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ vīsampi jātiyaḥ tisampi jātiyaḥ
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi
analyzed: cattālīsam pi jātiyaḥ paññāsam pi jātiyaḥ jāti satam pi jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi
translated: I recollected my manifold past lives, i.e. one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births, a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and evolution: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;

original: anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe: ‘amutrāsiṁ
analyzed: aneke api savaṭṭa kappe aneke api vivaṭṭa kappe aneke api savaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe amutra asi
translated: and passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term; and passing away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus with its aspects and particulars I recollected my manifold past lives.

original: evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto.
analyzed: eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto
translated: I was of such a name, of such a clan, of such an appearance, of such a diet, of such an experience of pleasure and pain, of such a life-term;

original: So tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ; tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī🔽evamāyupariyanto. So tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti. Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī  evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihita
translated: and passing away from there, I reappeared elsewhere; and there too I was of such a name, of such a clan, of such an appearance, of such a diet, of such an experience of pleasure and pain, of such a life-term;

original: pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: and passing away from there, I reappeared here.’ Thus with their aspects and particulars I remember my manifold past lives.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā;
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the first true knowledge attained by me in the first watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was banished and knowledge arose, darkness was banished and light arose, as happens in one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa paṭhamā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This was the first breaking out of the net of views for me when I was still only a bodhisatta, not fully enlightened.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne
translated: When my concentrated mind was purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi: ‘ime🔽vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā, vacīduccaritena samannāgatā, manoduccaritena🔽samannāgatā, ariyānaṁ upavādakā, micchādiṭṭhikā, micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā. Te kāyassa🔽bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannāti. Ime vā pana bhonto
analyzed: hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāmi ime  vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena  samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa  bhedāḥ param maraṇāḥ apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam ime vā pana bhontaḥ
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus:🔽‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā, vacīsucaritena samannāgatā, manosucaritena samannāgatā,
analyzed: sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatā vacī su caritena samannāgatā manaḥ su caritena samannāgatā
translated: But these worthy beings who are well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.’🔽Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: ariyānaṁ anupavādakā, sammādiṭṭhikā, sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā. Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ
analyzed: ariyānaṃ an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa bhedā para
translated: They do not revile noble ones, they hold right view, and undertake actions based on right view. After death, at the breaking-up of the body,

original: maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti. Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena
analyzed: maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena
translated: they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly world.’ Thus with my divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human,

original: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate
analyzed: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate
translated: I see beings passing away and arising: inferior and superior, fair and ugly, in a good place or a bad place.

original: yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi.
analyzed: yathā kammūpage satte pajānāmi
translated: I understand how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā;
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the second knowledge I attained in the middle part of the night.🔽Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose;

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: darkness was destroyed; light arose, as happens for one who is heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, dutiyā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa dutiyā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This was my second breakthrough, like the chick breaking out of the eggshell.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ;🔽‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,
analyzed: abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam  ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘These are the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw thus, my mind was liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.🔽When it was liberated there came the knowledge: ‘It is liberated.’

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: and I knew that it was so.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I understood: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā;
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the third true insight, which I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was banished and knowledge arose, darkness was banished and light arose, as happens in one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, tatiyā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa tatiyā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamha ati
translated: This was my third breakthrough, like the chick breaking out of the eggshell.”

analyzed: evam vutte verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin of Verañjā said to the Lord:

analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ bhavam gotamo seṭṭhaḥ bhavam gotamo
translated: “Master Gotama is the elder, Master Gotama is the best.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: Excellent, Lord Gotama, excellent!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: It is as if someone were to set up what had been knocked down, or to point out the way to one who had got lost, or to bring an oil-lamp into a dark place, so that those with eyes could see what was there.

analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti

analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: so too, in many ways, the Buddha has made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to the Buddha for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Paṭhamaṁ.

translated: The first section for recitation on the wanderer Sāriputta is finished.

analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 2. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga

analyzed: sīhasutta

analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā  sannipatitāḥ aneka pariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsanti dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsanti
translated: Now on that occasion many well-known Licchavīs were sitting together in the public hall,

translated: praising the Tathāgata in many ways: “Visioned is the Blessed One, perfected, fully awakened, accomplished in true knowledge & conduct, well-gone, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people to be tamed, teacher of gods & humans, awakened, the Blessed One.🔽Visioned is the Dathāgata, perfected, fully awakened, accomplished in true knowledge & conduct, well-gone, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people to be tamed, teacher of gods & humans, awakened, the Blessed One.

analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sīhaḥ senāpati nigaṇṭha sāvako tassam parisāyam nisinno hoti

translated: Then it occurred to him:

analyzed: nissasayam kho saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bhavissati tathā hime sambahulā
translated: “Undoubtedly that Blessed One is a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, since these many

analyzed: abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā aneka pariyāyena buddhassa

translated: Why don’t I go to see that Blessed One, perfected one, fully awakened Buddha?”

analyzed: samaṇaḥ hi sīha gotamaḥ a kiriya vādaḥ a kiriyāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: For the ascetic Gotama advocates non-doing and trains his disciples in the doctrine of non-doing.”

analyzed: atha kho sīhassa senāpatissa yaḥ ahosi gamiya abhisaṅkhāraḥ bhagavantam dassanāya so paṭippassambhi

translated: And a second time, a number of well-known Licchavīs, sitting together assembled in the public hall, spoke in many ways in praise of the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha.

analyzed: nissasayam kho saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bhavissati tathā hime sambahulā  abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā aneka pariyāyena buddhassa
translated: “No doubt that Blessed One is an arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, since these well-known Licchavīs

translated: speak in many ways in praise of the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha.

analyzed: yat nūna aham tam bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkameyyam arahantam sammāsambuddham ti
translated: Why don’t I go to see the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha?”

translated: The contemplative Gotama is one who advocates for inaction, teaches for inaction, and trains his disciples in inaction.”

translated: And a third time, a number of well-known Licchavīs, after the meal, on their return from alms round, entered the assembly hall and sat down. And a third time, they praised the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha in many ways.

translated: would say:

original: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ apagabbha tāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is free from lust. He teaches a Dhamma for the sake of freedom from lust, and he trains his disciples accordingly.’

original: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “Sīha, there is a way in which one could rightly say of me:

original: ‘assāsako samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
analyzed: assāsakaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ assāsāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an enticer of ascetics, a destroyer of growth, who teaches a Dhamma for the sake of non-performance.’

original: Ahañhi, sīha, assāsako paramena assāsena, assāsāya dhammaṁ desemi, tena ca sāvake vinemi.
analyzed: aham hi sīha assāsako paramena assāsena assāsāya dhammam desemi tena ca sāvake vinemi
translated: I am an enticer of ascetics, a destroyer of growth, who teaches a Dhamma for the sake of non-performance.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way in which one could rightly say of me:

original: ‘assāsako samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’”ti.
analyzed: assāsakaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ assāsāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an enticer of ascetics, a destroyer of growth, who teaches a Dhamma for the sake of non-performance.’”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sīho senāpati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte sīhaḥ senāpati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Sīha said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam ma bhante bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: From today let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: “Anuviccakāraṁ kho, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī”ti.
analyzed: anuviccakāram kho sīha karohi anuviccakāro tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: “Sīha, you should act in accordance with what is proper. It is proper for wise men like you to act in accordance with what is proper.”

original: “Imināpāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṁ maṁ bhagavā
analyzed: iminā apa āha bhante bhagavataḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya atta manaḥ abhiraddhaḥ yam mama bhagavā
translated: “Venerable sir, I am even more pleased and satisfied with the Blessed One

original: evamāha: ‘anuviccakāraṁ kho, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī’ti.
analyzed: evam āha anuviccakāram kho sīha karohi anuviccakāro tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: for saying this: ‘Sīha, you should act in accordance with what is proper. It is proper for wise men like you to act in accordance with what is proper.’

original: Mañhi, bhante, aññatitthiyā sāvakaṁ labhitvā kevalakappaṁ vesāliṁ paṭākaṁ parihareyyuṁ:
analyzed: mañhi bhante añña titthiyā sāvakam labhitvā kevala kappam vesālim paṭākam parihareyyu
translated: For, venerable sir, if the wanderers of other sects were to get to hear of this, they might say:

original: ‘sīho amhākaṁ senāpati sāvakattaṁ upagato’ti.
analyzed: sīhaḥ amhākam senāpati sāvaka ttam upagataḥ iti
translated: ‘The general Sīha has gone over to the disciples of the recluse Gotama and has become one of their disciples.’

original: Atha ca pana bhagavā evamāha: ‘anuviccakāraṁ, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī’ti.
analyzed: atha ca pana bhagavā evam āha anuviccakāra sīha karohi tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: But the Blessed One says: ‘Sīha, you should act in accordance with what is proper. It is proper for wise men like you to act in accordance with what is proper.’

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, dutiyampi bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante dutiyam pi bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: So, venerable sir, for a second time I go to the Blessed One for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Venerable sir, let the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: “Dīgharattaṁ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṁ opānabhūtaṁ kulaṁ, yena nesaṁ upagatānaṁ piṇḍakaṁ dātabbaṁ maññeyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: dīgharattam kho te sīha nigaṇṭhānam opāna bhūtam kula yena na īsam upagatānam piṇḍakam dātabbam maññeyyāsi iti
translated: “Sīha, your family has long been a supporter of the Niganthas. You should consider giving alms to them when they come.”

original: “Imināpāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha:🔽‘dīgharattaṁ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṁ opānabhūtaṁ kulaṁ, yena nesaṁ upagatānaṁ piṇḍakaṁ dātabbaṁ maññeyyāsī’ti.
analyzed: iminā apāha bhante bhagavataḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya atta manaḥ abhiraddhaḥ yam mama bhagavā evam āha  dīgharattam kho te sīha nigaṇṭhānam opāna bhūtam kula yena na īsam upagatānam piṇḍakam dātabbam maññeyyāsi iti
translated: “I’m even more satisfied and happy that the Buddha has said this.🔽My family has long been a supporter of the Niganthas. I should consider giving alms to them when they come.

original: Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante
translated: I’ve heard that the Buddha says:

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo evamāha—🔽mayhameva dānaṁ dātabbaṁ, mayhameva sāvakānaṁ dātabbaṁ;🔽mayhameva dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ, na aññesaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ;
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ evam āha  mayham eva dānam dātabba mayham eva sāvakānam dātabba  mayham eva dinnam mahat phala na aññesam dinnam mahat phala
translated: ‘You should only give to me and my disciples.🔽Only what’s given to me has great fruit, not what’s given to others.

original: mayhameva sāvakānaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ, na aññesaṁ sāvakānaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalan’ti,
analyzed: mayham eva sāvakānam dinnam mahapphala na aññesam sāvakānam dinnam mahapphalanti
translated: Only what’s given to my disciples has great fruit, not what’s given to the disciples of others.’

original: atha ca pana maṁ bhagavā nigaṇṭhesupi dāne samādapeti.
analyzed: atha ca pana mam bhagavā dāne samādapa iti
translated: And yet the Buddha encourages me to give to the Niganthas.

original: Api ca, bhante, mayamettha kālaṁ jānissāma.
analyzed: api ca bhante mayam ettha kālam jānissāma
translated: But I’ll know the right time for that.”

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, tatiyampi bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante tatiyam pi bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: For the third time, I go to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha for refuge.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam ma bhante bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha then gave Seniya the householder a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ, kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: that is, talk on generosity, talk on morality, talk on heaven, and the dangers, disadvantages, and defilement of sensual pleasures, and the benefits of renunciation.

original: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi sīhaṁ senāpatiṁ kallacittaṁ muducittaṁ vinīvaraṇacittaṁ udaggacittaṁ pasannacittaṁ, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā bhagavā aññāsi sīham senāpatim kalla cittam mudu cittam vinīvaraṇa cittam udagga cittam pasanna citta atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that Seniya’s mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: dukkham samudayam nirodham magga  seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.🔽Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evamevaṁ sīhassa senāpatissa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
analyzed: evam evam sīhassa senāpatissa tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way, while Seniya was sitting right there, he experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Whatever has the nature of arising, all that has the nature of ceasing.”

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati diṭṭha dhammo patta dhammo vidita dhammo pariyogāḷha dhammo tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ vigata kathaṅkathaḥ vesārajja ppattaḥ apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Sīha, having seen the Dhamma, attained the Dhamma, understood the Dhamma, penetrated the Dhamma, crossed over uncertainty, being without doubt, having attained full confidence, having become independent of others in the Teacher’s teaching, said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: “May the Fortunate One consent, reverend Sir, to me (offering him) a meal tomorrow, together with the Community of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Fortunate One consented by maintaining silence.

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpatiḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Then Sīha, having understood the Fortunate One’s consent, after rising from his seat, worshipping and circumambulating the Fortunate One, went away.

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Then Sīha addressed a certain man, (saying):

original: “gaccha tvaṁ, ambho purisa, pavattamaṁsaṁ jānāhī”ti.
analyzed: gaccha tva ambho purisa pavattamasam jānāhi iti
translated: “Go, dear Sir, and find out about the meat.”

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi
translated: Then Sīha, after the night had passed, having had excellent comestibles and edibles prepared in his own house, had the time announced to the Fortunate One, (saying):🔽“It is time, reverend Sir, the meal is ready.”

original: “kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “Venerable Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the residence of Sīha the general, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṁ rathikāya rathikaṁ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṁ bāhā paggayha kandanti:
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena sambahulāḥ nigaṇṭhāḥ vesāliyam rathikāya rathikam siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakam bāhā paggayha kandanti
translated: At that time a number of Niganthas were walking up and down in Vesālī, calling out and lamenting,

original: “ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṁ pasuṁ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṁ kataṁ.
analyzed: ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlam pasum vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattam kata
translated: “Today Sīha the general has killed a large animal for the sake of the ascetic Gotama.

original: Taṁ samaṇo gotamo jānaṁ uddissakataṁ maṁsaṁ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman”ti.
analyzed: tam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānam uddissa katam masam paribhuñjati paṭiccakammanti
translated: The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat that has been dedicated to him, after seeing, hearing, or suspecting.”

original: Atha kho aññataro puriso yena sīho senāpati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi:
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ purisaḥ yena sīhaḥ senāpati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi
translated: Then a certain man went to Sīha the general and whispered in his ear,

original: “yagghe, bhante, jāneyyāsi.
analyzed: yat he bhante jāneyyā asi
translated: “Sir, you should know that

original: Ete sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṁ rathikāya rathikaṁ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṁ bāhā paggayha kandanti:
analyzed: ete sambahulāḥ nigaṇṭhāḥ vesāliyam rathikāya rathikam siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakam bāhā paggayha kandanti
translated: and were running around Vesālī, their arms raised in despair, crying:

original: ‘ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṁ pasuṁ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṁ kataṁ.
analyzed: ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlam pasum vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattam kata
translated: ‘Today, the general Sīha has killed a large animal and prepared a meal for the ascetic Gotama.

original: Taṁ samaṇo gotamo jānaṁ uddissakataṁ maṁsaṁ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman’ti.
analyzed: tam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānam uddissa katam masam paribhuñjati paṭiccakammanti
translated: The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat that has been procured for him after ordering it.’

original: Alaṁ ayyo dīgharattañhi te āyasmanto avaṇṇakāmā buddhassa avaṇṇakāmā dhammassa avaṇṇakāmā saṅghassa.
analyzed: alam ayyaḥ dīgharattam hi te āyasmantaḥ avaṇṇa kāmāḥ buddhassa avaṇṇa kāmāḥ dhammassa avaṇṇa kāmāḥ saṅghassa
translated: ‘Enough, sirs, for a long time you have been speaking dispraise of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Na ca panete āyasmanto jiridanti taṁ bhagavantaṁ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhituṁ;
analyzed: na ca pana ete āyasmantaḥ jiridanti tam bhagavantam asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhitu
translated: But you are not able to defame the Blessed One, who is accomplished and fully enlightened, with anything that is untrue or mistaken.

original: na ca mayaṁ jīvitahetupi sañcicca pāṇaṁ jīvitā voropeyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: na ca mayam sañcit ca pāṇam jīvitā voropeyyāma ati
translated: And we would not kill a living being even to save our lives.’

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Then the general Sīha served and satisfied the Sangha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with his own hands with exquisite hard and soft food.

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Sīha sat down to one side.🔽The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho sīhaṁ senāpatiṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho sīham senāpatim bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi iti  dutiya
translated: The second section on Sīha is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.13
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 2. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Great Chapter

original: Assājānīyasutta
analyzed: assājānīya sutta
translated: A Thoroughbred Horse

original: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo assājānīyo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅganteva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgataḥ raññaḥ bhaddaḥ assa ajānīyaḥ rājā arahaḥ hoti rāja bhoggaḥ raññaḥ aṅga antā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: “Monks, a thoroughbred horse with eight factors is fit for a king, is the king’s equal, and is reckoned as a factor of a king.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo assājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti—🔽mātito ca pitito ca.
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi  idha bhikkhave raññaḥ bhaddaḥ assājānīyaḥ ubhatas sujātaḥ hoti  mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca
translated: What eight?🔽There is the case where a thoroughbred horse is well-born on both the mother’s and the father’s side.

original: Yassaṁ disāyaṁ aññepi bhaddā assājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṁ disāyaṁ jāto hoti.
analyzed: yassam disā ayam aññe pi bhaddāḥ assājānīyāḥ jāyanti tassam disā ayam jātaḥ hoti
translated: He is born in a good country.

original: Yaṁ kho panassa bhojanaṁ denti—
analyzed: yam kho panassa bhojanam denti
translated: Whatever food they give him—

original: allaṁ vā sukkhaṁ vā—
analyzed: allam vā sukkham vā
translated: whether fresh or dry—

original: taṁ sakkaccaṁyeva paribhuñjati avikiranto.
analyzed: tam sakkaccayā iva paribhuñjati a vikirantaḥ
translated: he eats it carefully, without scattering any.

original: Jegucchī hoti uccāraṁ vā passāvaṁ vā abhinisīdituṁ vā abhinipajjituṁ vā.
analyzed: jegucchī hoti uccāram vā passāvam vā abhinisīditum vā abhinipajjitum vā
translated: He is disgusted by the thought of sitting down or lying down on urine or excrement.

original: Sorato hoti sukhasaṁvāso, na ca aññe asse ubbejetā.
analyzed: sorataḥ hoti sukha savāsaḥ na ca aññe asse ubbejetā
translated: He is easy to tend to and pleasant to live with. He does not get angry at the driver.

original: Yāni kho panassa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṁ sārathissa āvikattā hoti.
analyzed: yāni kho pana assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni tāni yathābhūtam sārathissa āvikattā hoti
translated: He reveals to the driver any tricks he knows about other horses.

original: Tesamassa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.
analyzed: tesamassa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati
translated: The driver makes an effort to control him.

original: Vāhī kho pana hoti.
analyzed: vāhī kha u pana hoti
translated: He is a goer.

original: ‘Kāmaññe assā vahantu vā mā vā, ahamettha vahissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādeti.
analyzed: kāmaññe assāḥ vahantu vā mā vā aham ettha vahissāmi iti cittam uppādeti
translated: He thinks, ‘Let the other horses pull or not, I will pull here.’

original: Gacchanto kho pana ujumaggeneva gacchati.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ kho pana uju maggena iva gacchati
translated: When going, he goes straight on the straight path.

original: Thāmavā hoti yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā thāmaṁ upadaṁsetā.
analyzed: thāmam
translated: He is strong, and he applies his strength until the end of his life.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo assājānīyo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅganteva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi aṅgehi samannāgataḥ raññaḥ bhaddaḥ assa ajānīyaḥ rājā arahaḥ hoti rāja bhoggaḥ raññaḥ aṅgantā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: “A fine thoroughbred horse of a king endowed with these eight factors is worthy of a king, is fit to serve a king, and is reckoned as a factor of a king.🔽“A fine thoroughbred person of a noble family endowed with eight factors is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutations, an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti …pe… anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassa.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu āhuneyyaḥ hoti pe anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa
translated: “So too, bhikkhus, when a bhikkhu possesses eight qualities, he is an object of veneration…a supreme field of merit for the world.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What are the eight?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: Here, a bhikkhu is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, he is perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, he trains by undertaking the training precepts.

original: Yaṁ kho panassa bhojanaṁ denti—
analyzed: yam kho panassa bhojanam denti
translated: Whatever food and drink he receives from a donor,

original: lūkhaṁ vā paṇītaṁ vā—
analyzed: lūkham vā paṇītam vā
translated: whether coarse or excellent,

original: taṁ sakkaccaṁyeva paribhuñjati avihaññamāno.
analyzed: tam sakkaccayā iva paribhuñjati a vihaññamānaḥ
translated: he consumes without disparaging the donor.

original: Jegucchī hoti kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena;🔽jegucchī hoti anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā.
analyzed: jegucchī hoti kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena  jegucchī hoti aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā
translated: He is disgusted with bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct;🔽he is disgusted with the manifold evil and unwholesome states that constitute the fetters.

original: Sorato hoti sukhasaṁvāso, na aññe bhikkhū ubbejetā.
analyzed: sorataḥ hoti sukha savāsaḥ na aññe bhikkhū ubbejetā
translated: He is easy to speak to, endowed with qualities that make him easy to speak to, and he is a credit to those who speak to him.

original: Yāni kho panassa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṁ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.
analyzed: yāni kho panassa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni tāni yathābhūtam āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu
translated: He reveals as it truly is his own bodily and mental processes to the Teacher or to his wise companions in the holy life.

original: Tesamassa satthā vā viññū vā sabrahmacārī abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.
analyzed: tesamassa satthā vā viññū vā sabrahmacārī abhinimmadanāya vā āyamati
translated: The Teacher or wise companions in the holy life try to inspire him to ardour through exhortation.

original: Sikkhitā kho pana hoti.
analyzed: sikkhitā kho pana hoti
translated: He is trained.

original: ‘Kāmaññe bhikkhū sikkhantu vā mā vā, ahamettha sikkhissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādeti.
analyzed: kāmaññe bhikkhū sikkhantu vā mā vā aham ettha sikkhissāmi iti cittam uppādeti
translated: ‘Whether other bhikkhus train or not, I shall train in the training of the Teacher.’

original: Gacchanto kho pana ujumaggeneva gacchati;
analyzed: gacchantaḥ kho pana uju maggena iva gacchati
translated: When he goes, he goes straight ahead,

original: tatrāyaṁ ujumaggo, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tatra ayam uju maggaḥ
translated: Herein, this is the straight way:

original: sammādiṭṭhi …pe… sammāsamādhi.
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: right view … right concentration.

original: Āraddhavīriyo viharati:
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati
translated: He dwells with energy aroused:

original: ‘kāmaṁ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṁsalohitaṁ; yaṁ
analyzed: kāmam taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu sarīre upassussatu ya
translated: ‘Let only skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood dry up in my body!

original: taṁ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṁ, na taṁ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
analyzed: tam purisa thāmena purisa vīriyena purisa parakkamena na tam apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
translated: But if I do not attain what can be reached by manly strength, manly effort, and manly persistence,

original: saṇṭhānaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: saṇṭhānam bhavissati iti
translated: I will not relax my energy.’

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti …pe… anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu āhuneyyaḥ hoti pe anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa ati  tatiya
translated: A monk who has these eight qualities is an object of veneration … an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.”🔽The third section on the one who deserves to be looked upon is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.14
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 2. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Division

original: Assakhaḷuṅkasutta
analyzed: assa khaḷuṅka sutta
translated: The Stubborn Horse

original: “Aṭṭha ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi aṭṭha ca assadose, aṭṭha ca purisakhaḷuṅke aṭṭha ca purisadose.
analyzed: aṭṭha ca bhikkhave assa khaḷuṅke desessāmi aṭṭha ca assa dose aṭṭha ca purisa khaḷuṅke aṭṭha ca purisa dose
translated: “Monks, I will teach you eight stubbornnesses of a horse, eight faults of a horse, eight stubbornnesses of a person, and eight faults of a person.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen & pay close attention. I will speak.

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “As you say, lord,” the monks responded.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: “Katame ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭha assakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca assadosā?
analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave aṭṭha assa khaḷuṅkāḥ aṭṭha ca assa dosā
translated: “And which are the eight stubbornnesses of a horse and eight faults of a horse?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā pacchatas paṭikkamati piṭṭhitaḥ ratham pavatteti
translated: There is the case where a stubbornness of a horse is this: When told, ‘Go,’ and pricked with the heel spur, it backs up.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: This is how a stubbornness of a horse is.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo assadoso.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave paṭhamaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the first fault of a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṁ hanati, tidaṇḍaṁ bhañjati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅko pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā pacchā laṅghati kubbaram hanati tidaṇḍam bhañjati
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with the whip and hook, a certain breed of horses rears up and kicks the pole and breaks the yoke-tie.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a certain breed of horses.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.
analyzed: bhikkhave dutiyaḥ
translated: This is the second fault of a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā rathīsāya satthiṁ ussajjitvā rathīsaṁyeva ajjhomaddati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā rathīsāya satthim ussajjitvā rathīsayā iva ajjhomaddati
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with the whip and hook, a certain breed of horses jumps up against the pole and tramples the pole-straps.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a certain breed of horses.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyo assadoso.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave tatiyaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the third fault of a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṁ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṁ rathaṁ karoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā ummaggam gaṇhati ubbaṭumam ratham karoti
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with the whip and hook, a certain breed of horses takes a wrong path and makes the chariot overturn.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a certain breed of horses.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave catutthaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the fourth fault of a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā laṅghati purimakāyaṁ paggaṇhati purime pāde.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā laṅghati purima kāyam paggaṇhati purime pāde
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with a whip or prod, a certain kind of thoroughbred horse rears up with its foreparts.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a certain kind of thoroughbred horse here.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo assadoso.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito
analyzed: aya bhikkhave pañcamaḥ assa doso  puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅko pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ
translated: This is the fifth fault of a horse.

original: sārathinā anādiyitvā sārathiṁ anādiyitvā patodalaṭṭhiṁ dantehi mukhādhānaṁ vidhaṁsitvā
analyzed: sārathinā an ādiyitvā sārathim an ādiyitvā patoda laṭṭhim dantehi mukha ādhānam vidhasitvā
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with a whip or prod, a certain kind of thoroughbred horse, disregarding the charioteer and disregarding the whip or prod,

original: yena kāmaṁ pakkamati.
analyzed: yena kāmam pakkamati
translated: breaks out with its teeth from the yoke pole and goes as it likes.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a certain kind of thoroughbred horse here.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, chaṭṭho assadoso.
analyzed: bhikkhave chaṭṭhaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the sixth fault of a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā neva abhikkamati no paṭikkamati tattheva khīlaṭṭhāyī ṭhito hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅko pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā na iva abhikkamati no paṭikkamati tattha eva khīla ṭṭhāyī ṭhitaḥ hoti
translated: “Again, when told to go forward, when whipped by the charioteer with a whip or prod, a certain kind of thoroughbred horse neither goes forward nor goes back but stands right there, planted like a stake.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a bad horse here.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, sattamo assadoso.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave sattamaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the seventh badness in a horse.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅko pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ
translated: “Again, a bad horse, on being told ‘Go!’ and whipped by the goad,

original: sārathinā purime ca pāde saṁharitvā pacchime ca pāde saṁharitvā tattheva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati.
analyzed: sārathinā purime ca pāde saharitvā pacchime ca pāde saharitvā tattha iva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati
translated: having retracted his forelegs and retracted his hind legs, sits right there on his four legs.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is a bad horse here.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, aṭṭhamo assadoso.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave aṭṭhamaḥ assa doso
translated: This is the eighth badness in a horse.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha assakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca assadosā.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave aṭṭha assa khaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca assa dosā
translated: “These are the eight badnesses in a horse and the eight badnesses in a person.

original: Katame ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭha purisakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca purisadosā?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṁ āpattiyā codenti.
analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave aṭṭha purisa khaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca purisa dosā  idha bhikkhave bhikkhū bhikkhum āpattiyā codenti
translated: “And what are the eight badnesses in a horse and the eight badnesses in a person?🔽“There is the case where a monk is accused of an offense.

original: So bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno ‘na sarāmī’ti asatiyā nibbeṭheti.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamānaḥ na sarāmi iti asatiyā nibbeṭheti
translated: “He says, ‘I don’t remember,’ and denies it through lack of memory.

original: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṁ vatteti;🔽tathūpamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imaṁ puggalaṁ vadāmi.🔽Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco purisakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ bhikkhave assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā pacchatas paṭikkamati piṭṭhitaḥ ratham vatteti  tathūpamā āha bhikkhave imam puggalam vadāmi  evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: so too is this person.🔽This is the first kind of person similar to a horse found in the world.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo purisadoso.
analyzed: bhikkhave paṭhamaḥ purisa doso
translated: This is the first kind of person similar to a horse found in the world.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṁ āpattiyā codenti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave bhikkhū bhikkhum āpattiyā codenti
translated: “Again, monks, a monk is charged by monks with an offense.

original: So bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakaṁyeva paṭippharati:
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamānaḥ codakayā iva paṭippharati
translated: But the monk, being charged with an offense by monks, retaliates against the chargers,

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho tuyhaṁ bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena.
analyzed: kim nu kho tuyham bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena
translated: saying, ‘What do you have to do with me, you fool, you good-for-nothing?

original: Tvampi nāma bhaṇitabbaṁ maññasī’ti.
analyzed: tvam pi nāma bhaṇitabbam maññasi iti
translated: You think you have to tell me what to do!’🔽Just as the horse, when told ‘Go!’ and pricked with the heel spur, rears up and kicks the chariot,

original: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṁ hanati, tidaṇḍaṁ bhañjati;🔽tathūpamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imaṁ puggalaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ bhikkhave assa khaḷuṅkaḥ pehi iti vuttaḥ viddhaḥ samānaḥ coditaḥ sārathinā pacchā laṅghati kubbaram hanati tidaṇḍam bhañjati 🔽tathūpamā āha bhikkhave imam puggalam vadāmi
translated: so too is this person.

original: Evarūpopi, bhikkhave, idhekacco purisakhaḷuṅko hoti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ api bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ hoti
translated: Such is the second kind of worthless man in the world.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo purisadoso.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṁ āpattiyā codenti.
analyzed: bhikkhave dutiyaḥ purisa doso  puna capara bhikkhave bhikkhū bhikkhum āpattiyā codenti
translated: This is the second failing of a man.🔽“Again, a monk is charged by the monks with an offense.

original: So bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakasseva paccāropeti:
analyzed: so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamānaḥ codakassa iva paccāropeti
translated: But he turns it back on the accuser:

original: ‘tvaṁ khosi itthannāmaṁ āpattiṁ āpanno, tvaṁ tāva paṭhamaṁ paṭikarohī’ti.
analyzed: tvam khalu asi itthannāmam āpattim āpannaḥ tvam tāva paṭhamam paṭikarohi iti
translated: ‘You’ve fallen into such-and-such offense. You clear yourself first, and then I’ll clear myself.’

analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
