analyzed: tassa nāgitaḥ evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘idāni imaṁ āyasmantaṁ ārāmiko vā upaṭṭhahissati samaṇuddeso vā. Taṁ tamhā samādhimhā cāvessatī’ti.
analyzed: idāni imam āyasmantam ārāmikaḥ vā upaṭṭhahissati samaṇuddesaḥ vā tam tamhā samādhimhā ca āvessati iti
translated: ‘Now, this venerable one will be served by a monastery worker or a novice attendant. He will be distracted from that concentration.’

original: Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno na attamano homi gāmantavihārena.🔽Idha panāhaṁ, nāgita, bhikkhuṁ passāmi āraññikaṁ araññe pacalāyamānaṁ nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno na attamanaḥ homi gāmanta vihārena  idha pana aha nāgita bhikkhum passāmi āraññikam araññe pacalāyamānam nisinna
translated: So, Nāgita, I am not pleased with that bhikkhu’s dwelling in a village.🔽Here, Nāgita, I see a certain person living in the forest who is restless in body and mind.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, nāgita, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa nāgitaḥ evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā imaṁ niddākilamathaṁ paṭivinodetvā araññasaññaṁyeva manasi karissati ekattan’ti.
analyzed: idāni ayam āyasmai imam niddā kilamatham paṭivinodetvā arañña saññayā iva manasi karissati ekattam ti
translated: ‘Now, this venerable one, having shaken off that sluggishness and drowsiness, will attend to the perception of light, and his mind will become bright.’

original: Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
analyzed: tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno attamanaḥ homi arañña vihārena
translated: So, Nāgita, I am pleased with that bhikkhu’s dwelling in the forest.

original: Idha panāhaṁ, nāgita, bhikkhuṁ passāmi āraññikaṁ araññe asamāhitaṁ nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: idha pana aha nāgita bhikkhum passāmi āraññikam araññe asamāhitam nisinna
translated: Here, Nāgita, I see a monk living in the forest who is not concentrated.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, nāgita, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa nāgitaḥ evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā asamāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ samādahissati, samāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ anurakkhissatī’ti.🔽Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.🔽Idha panāhaṁ, nāgita, bhikkhuṁ passāmi āraññikaṁ araññe samāhitaṁ nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: idāni ayam āyasmai asamāhitam vā cittam samādahissati samāhitam vā cittam anurakkhissati iti  tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno attamanaḥ homi arañña vihārena  idha pana aha nāgita bhikkhum passāmi āraññikam araññe samāhitam nisinna
translated: ‘Now this venerable one, not concentrating the mind, will guard it.’🔽I am pleased with that monk’s forest lodging.🔽Here, Nāgita, I see a monk living in the forest who is concentrated.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, nāgita, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa nāgitaḥ evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā avimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ vimuccissati, vimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ anurakkhissatī’ti.🔽Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
analyzed: idāni ayam āyasmai avimuttam vā cittam vimuccissati vimuttam vā cittam anurakkhissati iti  tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno attamanaḥ homi arañña vihārena
translated: ‘Now this venerable one, not liberating the mind, will guard it.’🔽I am pleased with that monk’s forest lodging.

original: Idha panāhaṁ, nāgita, bhikkhuṁ passāmi gāmantavihāriṁ lābhiṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: idha pana aha nāgita bhikkhum passāmi gāmantavihārim lābhim cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: Here, Nāgita, I see a monk living in the village area who obtains robe-cloth, almsfood, resting place, and medicinal requisites.

original: So taṁ lābhasakkārasilokaṁ nikāmayamāno riñcati paṭisallānaṁ, riñcati araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni;
analyzed: saḥ tam lābha sakkāra silokam nikāmayamānaḥ riñcati paṭisallāna riñcati arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni
translated: He delights in that gain, respect, and fame, and abandons seclusion, and abandons the wilderness and the forest and goes to live in a village.

original: gāmanigamarājadhāniṁ osaritvā vāsaṁ kappeti.
analyzed: gāma nigama rājadhānim osaritvā vāsam kappeti
translated: He goes to a town or city and makes his dwelling there.

original: Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno na attamano homi gāmantavihārena.
analyzed: tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno na attamanaḥ homi gāmanta vihārena
translated: I am not pleased with that bhikkhu’s dwelling in a village.

original: Idha panāhaṁ, nāgita, bhikkhuṁ passāmi āraññikaṁ lābhiṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: idha pana āha nāgita bhikkhum passāmi āraññikam lābhim cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: “Here, Nagita, I see a certain bhikkhu living in dependence on a village…

original: So taṁ lābhasakkārasilokaṁ paṭipaṇāmetvā na riñcati paṭisallānaṁ, na riñcati araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni.
analyzed: saḥ tam lābha sakkāra silokam paṭipaṇāmetvā na riñcati paṭisallāna na riñcati arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni
translated: He does not delight in that gain, respect, and fame, and does not abandon seclusion, and does not abandon the wilderness and the forest and the remote lodgings in the jungle, the thickets, and the mountains.

original: Tenāhaṁ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
analyzed: tena āha nāgita tassa bhikkhuno attamanaḥ homi arañña vihārena
translated: I am pleased with that bhikkhu’s dwelling in the forest.

original: Yasmāhaṁ, nāgita, samaye addhānamaggappaṭipanno na kañci passāmi purato vā pacchato vā, phāsu me, nāgita, tasmiṁ samaye hoti antamaso uccārapassāvakammāyā”ti.
analyzed: yasmā āha nāgita samaye addhāna magga paṭipannaḥ na kañci passāmi puratas vā pacchatas vā phāsu me nāgita tasmin samaye hoti antamasaḥ uccāra passāva kammāya ati
translated: When I am travelling along the highway and I do not see anyone in front or behind, then I feel at ease, Nagita, even to defecate and urinate.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: chaṭṭha
translated: The sixth.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.87
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: Numbered Discourses The Benefit of Faithfulness

original: 9. Sativagga
analyzed: sativagga
translated: The Chapter on Mindfulness

original: Pattanikujjanasutta
analyzed: patta nikujjana sutta
translated: Turning Over the Bowl

original: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṁ nikkujjeyya.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pattam nikkujjeyya
translated: “A monk who has eight qualities may, if he so wishes, be turned over by the Sangha.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What eight?

original: Bhikkhūnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṁ avāsāya
analyzed: bhikkhūnam alābhāya parisakkati bhikkhūnam anatthāya parisakkati bhikkhūnam a vāsāya
translated: He tries to prevent the monks from acquiring material gains. He tries to harm the monks. He tries to get the monks to leave the monastery.

original: parisakkati, bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ
analyzed: parisakkati bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti buddhassa avaṇṇa
translated: He abuses and reviles the monks. He causes division between the monks. He disparages the Buddha.

original: bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati.
analyzed: bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: He disparages the Teaching. He disparages the Sangha.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṁ nikkujjeyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭha haṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pattam nikkujjeyya
translated: A monk who has these eight qualities may, if he so wishes, be turned over by the Sangha.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṁ ukkujjeyya.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pattam ukkujjeyya
translated: A monk who has eight qualities may, if he so wishes, be turned over by the Sangha.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What eight?

original: Na bhikkhūnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: na bhikkhūnam alābhāya parisakkati na bhikkhūnam anatthāya parisakkati
translated: He doesn’t try to prevent the monks from acquiring material gains. He doesn’t try to harm the monks. He doesn’t try to get the monks to leave the monastery.

original: avāsāya parisakkati, na bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti,
analyzed: a vāsāya parisakkati na bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti
translated: he doesn’t try to get non-monastics to beat, threaten, fine, or banish monastics; he doesn’t abuse or revile monastics; he doesn’t cause division between monastics;

original: buddhassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati.
analyzed: buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa vaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: he speaks in praise of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṁ ukkujjeyyā”ti.🔽Sattamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.88
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭha haṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pattam ukkujjeyya ati  sattama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: When a lay follower has these eight qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, turn over a bowl to him.”

original: 9. Sativagga
analyzed: sativagga
translated: The seventh section on “with eight qualities” is finished.🔽The Collection of Numbered Sayings is finished.🔽The Collection of Numbered Sayings🔽The Chapter on Mindfulness

original: Appasādapavedanīyasutta
analyzed: appasāda pavedanīya sutta
translated: To Announce a Lack of Confidence in Someone

original: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā appasādaṁ pavedeyyuṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānāḥ upāsakāḥ appasādam pavedeyyu
translated: “Monks, if a monk has eight qualities, the laypeople may, if they wish, announce a lack of confidence in him.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What eight?

original: Gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati,
analyzed: gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati gihī akkosati paribhāsati
translated: He tries to get non-monastics to beat, threaten, fine, or banish monastics; he abuses and reviles monastics;

original: gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa🔽avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, agocare ca naṁ passanti.
analyzed: gihī gihīhi bhedeti buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa 🔽avaṇṇam bhāsati agocare ca nam passanti
translated: he causes division between monastics; he speaks in dispraise of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha;🔽and they see him misbehaving.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā appasādaṁ pavedeyyuṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānāḥ upāsakāḥ appasādam pavedeyyu
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, the lay followers may, if they wish, announce his lack of confidence.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā pasādaṁ pavedeyyuṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānāḥ upāsakāḥ pasādam pavedeyyu
translated: “When a monk has eight qualities, the lay followers may, if they wish, announce his confidence.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What are the eight?

original: Na gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, na gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, na gihī akkosati🔽paribhāsati, na gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati,
analyzed: na gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati na gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati na gihī akkosati  paribhāsati na gihī gihīhi bhedeti buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: He doesn’t try to get material possessions for the lay followers. He doesn’t try to get what’s unsuitable for the lay followers. He doesn’t insult or revile the lay followers.

original: saṅghassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, gocare ca naṁ passanti.
analyzed: saṅghassa vaṇṇam bhāsati gocare ca nam passanti
translated: He doesn’t cause division between the lay followers and the monks. He praises the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha. And he’s seen to be living purely.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā pasādaṁ pavedeyyun”ti.🔽Aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānāḥ upāsakāḥ pasādam pavedeyyun ti  aṭṭhama
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, the lay followers may, if they wish, announce his confidence.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.89🔽9. Sativagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  sativagga
translated: The eighth section on the lay followers is finished.🔽The Collection of Numbered Sayings is finished.🔽The Collection of Numbered Sayings🔽The Chapter on Mindfulness

original: Paṭisāraṇīyasutta
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya sutta
translated: Reconciliation

original: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: “When a monk has eight qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What are the eight?🔽He tries to get families to not give gains to other monks.

original: Gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati,
analyzed: gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati gihī akkosati paribhāsati
translated: He tries to harm families. He abuses and reviles families.

original: gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa
analyzed: gihī gihīhi bhedeti buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa
translated: He causes families to split apart. He disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammikañca gihipaṭissavaṁ na saccāpeti.
analyzed: avaṇṇam bhāsati dhammikam ca gihi paṭissavam na saccā apeti
translated: He doesn’t fulfill his promises to families.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyaṁ kammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīyam kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: “When a monk has eight qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, lift a legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Katamehi aṭṭhahi?
analyzed: katamehi aṭṭhahi
translated: What are the eight?🔽He doesn’t try to get families to not give gains to other monks.

original: Na gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, na gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, na gihī akkosati
analyzed: na gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati na gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati na gihī akkosati
translated: He doesn’t try to harm families.

original: paribhāsati, na gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati,
analyzed: paribhāsati na gihī gihīhi bhedeti buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: he doesn’t cause division between householders; he praises the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha;

original: saṅghassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammikañca gihipaṭissavaṁ saccāpeti.
analyzed: saṅghassa vaṇṇam bhāsati dhammikam ca gihi paṭissavam saccā apeti
translated: and he fulfills the householders’ conditions for giving.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyyā”ti.🔽Navamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.90
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambheyya ati  navama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.”

original: 9. Sativagga
analyzed: sativagga
translated: 9. The ninth section on the lifting of the legal procedure of reconciliation

original: Sammāvattanasutta
analyzed: sammāvattana sutta
translated: The Group on Mindfulness🔽Correct behavior

original: “Tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbaṁ—🔽na upasampādetabbo, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na bhikkhunovādakasammuti🔽sāditabbā, sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā, na kāci saṅghasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: tassapāpiyasika kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā  na upasampādetabbaḥ na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ na bhikkhunovādaka sammuti  sāditabbā sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā na kāci saṅgha sammuti sāditabbā
translated: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of further penalty done against himself should behave correctly in eight respects:🔽he shouldn’t give the full ordination; he shouldn’t give formal support; he shouldn’t accept being looked after by a trainee nun; he shouldn’t consent to being corrected about what is proper and improper;

original: na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo, na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbaḥ na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t consent to being instructed; he shouldn’t instruct the nuns even if he’s asked; he shouldn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of further penalty against him; and he shouldn’t, in his obstinacy, refuse to give up a bad view.

original: Tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā imesu aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
analyzed: tassapāpiyasika kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā imesu aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbanti
translated: “A monk who’s had a further-punishment procedure done against him should behave properly in these eight ways.”

original: Dasamaṁ.🔽Sativaggo catuttho.
analyzed: dasama  sati vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on mindfulness is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Satipuṇṇiyamūlena,🔽Corasamaṇena pañcamaṁ;
analyzed: satipuṇṇiya mūlena  cora samaṇena pañcama
translated: Mindfulness, Puṇṇikā, root,🔽Thief, monk, fifth;

original: Yaso pattappasādena,

original: Rūpī rūpāni passati, ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati, subhanteva adhimutto🔽hoti, sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ🔽amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ🔽samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso
analyzed: rūpī rūpāni passati ajjhattam a rūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati subhantā iva adhimuttaḥ  hoti sabbaso rūpa saññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭigha saññānaṃ atthaṅgamā nānatta saññānaṃ  a manasikārā anantaḥ ākāsaḥ ti ākāsa anañca āyatanam upasampajja viharati sabbaso ākāsa anañca āyatana  samatikkamma anantam viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatanam upasampajja viharati sabbaso
translated: He sees forms internally and has a perception of forms externally, fair and ugly, and having overcome them, he is percipient thus: ‘I know, I see.’🔽He becomes intent on abandoning identification,🔽and on not attending to perceptions connected with the diversity of perceptions,🔽he is percipient thus: ‘Space is infinite,’ and he enters and dwells in the base of the infinity of space.🔽He becomes intent on abandoning the base of the infinity of space,🔽and on not attending to the base of the infinity of space,🔽he is percipient thus: ‘Consciousness is infinite,’ and he enters and dwells in the base of the infinity of consciousness.

original: viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,🔽sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,🔽sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati—
analyzed: viññāṇañca āyatanam samatikkamma na atthi kiñci iti ākiñcaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati  sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati  sabbasas nevasaññā nāsañña āyatanam samatikkamma saññā vedayita nirodham upasampajja viharati
translated: One with form sees forms. One, not perceiving forms internally, sees forms externally. One is intent only on the beautiful. One, having completely transcended the sphere of endless space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite,’ enters and dwells in the sphere of infinite consciousness. One, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all,’ enters and dwells in the sphere of nothingness. One, having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness, enters and dwells in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception. One, having completely transcended the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, enters and dwells in the cessation of perception and feeling.
